introduction: On Friday, Swiss antibody-drug conjugate specialist ADC Therapeutics saw its shares gain almost 5% to $24.40 after-hours, as it revealed that the US Food and Drug Administration has granted accelerated approval for Zynlonta (loncastuximab tesirine-lpyl).
content:
On Friday, Swiss antibody-drug conjugate specialist ADC Therapeutics (NYSE: ADCT) saw its shares gain almost 5% to $24.40 after-hours, as it revealed that the US Food and Drug Administration has granted accelerated approval for Zynlonta (loncastuximab tesirine-lpyl).

The drug is cleared for the treatment of adult patients with relapsed or refractory (r/r) large B-cell lymphoma after two or more lines of systemic therapy, including diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) not otherwise specified (NOS), DLBCL arising from low grade lymphoma and high-grade B-cell lymphoma.

Zynlonta is the first and only CD19-targeted antibody drug conjugate (ADC) for the treatment of r/r DLBCL. Zynlonta fills a significant unmet need in r/r DLBCL in heavily pre-treated patients with difficult to treat disease and has the potential to become the standard of care in 3L+ DLBCL. The 3L+ DLBCL total market consists of 10,500 patients in the USA/EU5 and represents a $1 billion+ opportunity, according to the company.

Clinical backing

The accelerated approval of Zynlonta, which came ahead of the Prescription Drug User Fee Act (PDUFA) target date of May 21, is based on data from the LOTIS-2 trial, which demonstrated:

  • Robust single-agent activity across a broad patient population;
  • 48.3% overall response rate, 24.1% complete response rate, durable responses in heavily pre-treated patients;
  • Median duration of response of more than 10.3 months (BLA submission); 12.6 months for all responders and 13.4 months for patients who had a complete response (more mature data since the submission); and
  • Manageable toxicity profile

The FDA approval is strong validation of the company’s ADC platform and lead product, which also has the potential to be used in combination and in additional indications and lines of treatment, the company noted. ADC Therapeutics’ proprietary PBD dimer toxins make Zynlonta highly potent. The PBDs cross link in the DNA of cancer cells, enabling them to elude DNA repair/cancer resistance mechanisms. This allows for a longer-lasting effect on cancer cells.

Zynlonta will be commercially available in the USA shortly. ADC Therapeutics has launched the Advancing Patient Support Program, a comprehensive patient support program offering financial assistance, ongoing education and other resources to eligible patients who are prescribed Zynlonta.
